author: Agence France-Presse, Agence France-Presse
title: PGA Tour: Tony Finau leads windy Houston Open as China’s Carl Yuan suffers meltdown
description: Tony Finau fires two-under par 68 to maintain four-shot lead heading into final round, as Carl Yuan collapses on Saturday following first cut of fledgling PGA Tour career.

author: Sonia Sarkar, Sonia Sarkar
title: Pregnant women caught in Pakistan’s floods left struggling for maternal healthcare
description: Some 650,000 pregnant women in flood-hit provinces are affected by maternal malnutrition; unregulated use of medicines, untrained birth attendants, lack of access to health facilities among problems post-floods.

author: Tony Cheung, Tony Cheung
title: Health minister to discuss increasing hotel quarantine quota with authorities to allow more Honkongers to visit mainland
description: Health minister says mainland China’s new quarantine rules will allow it to open up to international travellers.

author: Bloomberg, Bloomberg
title: Malaysia election 2022: thousands evacuated as monsoon-season flash floods affect campaigns
description: The floods have sparked renewed criticism of the decision by Prime Minister Ismail Sabri Yakoob’s government to call an early election on November 19 during the monsoon season.

author: Bloomberg, Bloomberg
title: China plans to rescue property firms in strongest sign yet that policymakers are easing a years-long clampdown on sector
description: China has unveiled its most sweeping rescue package to bail out a real estate market mired in a record slowdown and deepening liquidity crunch, according to people familiar with the matter.

author: Kristin Huang, Kristin Huang
title: China showcases never before seen range of unmanned maritime vehicles at Zhuhai air show
description: China has been pouring resources into sector that could change naval warfare, in bid to catch up with the US and Canada.

author: Kalpana Sunder, Kalpana Sunder
title: Young Indians snap up second-hand clothes as more seek unique, sustainable alternatives to fast fashion
description: Many thrift and secondhand clothes shops on Instagram began with users decluttering their wardrobe, who gave away or sold cheaply the clothes that they no longer used.

author: Liya Su, Liya Su
title: ‘Life and death’: firefighters free drunk Chinese women from padlocked iron neck chain after they throw key down toilet
description: A ‘life and death’ drinking game made popular via Chinese social media has faced a barrage of criticism after firefighters were forced to use bolt cutters to free two drunk women who padlocked themselves together around the neck and threw the key down a toile…

author: Jun Mai, Jun Mai
title: China wants stronger ties with Japan, Premier Li Keqiang tells Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Kishida will be at Bali G20 summit and Apec talks in Bangkok, but no meeting has been officially confirmed yet.

author: Nicolas Atkin, Nicolas Atkin
title: UFC 281: Zhang Weili submits Carla Esparza to reclaim strawweight title
description: Chinese superstar becomes a two-time champion with a ruthless masterclass in Madison Square Garden, on a night of wild action.

author: Kate Whitehead, Kate Whitehead
title: ‘I have two brains’: Hong Kong artist Eddie Lui on his rational and sensual sides, his struggles in the city, and dealing with angry triads
description: An ex-banker who held his first solo art exhibition in 1973, artist Eddie Lui talks about his Hong Kong struggle, being raised between East and West, and dealing with angry triads.

author: Agence France-Presse, Agence France-Presse
title: Biden seeks North Korea strategy in talks with Japan, South Korea before Xi Jinping meeting at G20
description: A record-breaking spate of launches by North Korea in recent weeks has sent fears soaring that the reclusive regime will soon carry out its seventh nuclear test.

author: Associated Press, Associated Press
title: Formula 1: Joy for Mercedes as George Russel tops Brazilian GP sprint race
description: Formula One team Mercedes had a day to remember at the Brazilian Grand Prix on Saturday. Alpine had a day to forget.

author: Annesha Ghosh, Annesha Ghosh
title: India’s women cricketers will now be paid the same as the men – and they say it’s about time
description: ‘It’s a very important step forward for women’s cricket in our country,’ says India all-rounder Sneh Rana.

author: Yanni Chow, Yanni Chow
title: Halal in Hong Kong: Muslims cheer KFC’s move, hope more fast-food chains, restaurants will cater to community
description: Choices are limited for the city’s 300,000 Muslims, as there are only 63 halal-certified restaurants.

author: Amber Wang, Amber Wang
title: South China Sea code of conduct harder to negotiate in more ‘complicated’ situation, think tank says
description: US ‘no longer neutral’ on the issue and will ‘support whoever is against China’, according to head of Chinese institute.

author: Agence France-Presse, Agence France-Presse
title: Verdict of 4 men on trial for Malaysia Airlines MH17 disaster to be delivered by Dutch court on Thursday
description: Dutch judges will give their verdict on Thursday in the trial of four men accused of downing Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 over Ukraine in 2014, against a backdrop of soaring tensions over Russia’s current invasion.

author: Letters, Letters
title: Hong Kong school curriculum must get with the program
description: Readers discuss the importance of upgrading the school curriculum to include the programming language Python, and how to tackle the problem of excessive homework.

author: Richard James Havis, Richard James Havis
title: Is the ‘brotherly love’ in martial arts films homoerotic? Why Chang Cheh rejected fellow director Stanley Kwan’s reading of his films
description: Stanley Kwan used a 1997 documentary to argue the male bonding in director Chang Cheh’s films is homoerotic, but Chang tells him emphatically it is not.

author: Ben Jiang, Ben Jiang
title: Alibaba-backed Ele.me unveils new smart helmet tailored for delivery riders, designed to improve safety and efficiency
description: Ele.me debuts a new smart helmet at World Internet Conference aimed at improving road safety for the country’s millions of hard-pressed delivery riders.

author: Connor Mycroft,Mia Nulimaimaiti, Connor Mycroft,Mia Nulimaimaiti
title: Can green transition help China’s northeast shake off its ‘rust belt’ moniker with a new clean-energy engine?
description: Renewable energy offers abundant economic opportunities, but critics question if a green-energy build-up will be enough for the northeast region to counter the ingrained economic issues that have hindered its past efforts at revitalisation.

author: Reuters, Reuters
title: Democrats clinch control of US Senate with win in Nevada
description: With Catherine Cortez Masto’s victory, Democrats will control at least 50 Senate seats, with Vice-President Kamala Harris able to break ties in the 100-member chamber.

author: Edith Lin, Edith Lin
title: Hundreds of passengers evacuated after doors come off Hong Kong train at Yau Ma Tei MTR station, Tsuen Wan line partly suspended
description: Temporary halt in train services between Tsuen Wan line’s Lai King station and Jordan.

author: Anthony Rowley, Anthony Rowley
title: World needs global, coordinated climate action – and that won’t come from governments or private sector
description: After decades of urging private companies and individual governments to ‘do their part’ to tackle climate change, it’s clear the piecemeal approach isn’t working. Global cooperation requires multilateral institutions that are professionally and financially eq…

author: Jason Wordie, Jason Wordie
title: How art depicting southern Chinese scenes, by George Chinnery and others, became sought after, as did catalogues of collections such as that of Sir Paul Chater
description: Art depicting familiar southern Chinese scenes was popular among the merchants and officials of the China Trade, such as Hong Kong’s Sir Paul Chater.

author: Associated Press, Associated Press
title: Almost US$500 million in funds vanish at bankrupt crypto exchange FTX; probe under way
description: The embattled company’s new CEO John Ray III said on Saturday that FTX is switching off the ability to trade or withdraw funds and taking steps to secure customers’ assets.

author: Ben Jiang, Ben Jiang
title: Chinese tech billionaire Richard Liu gives up front office roles and direct ownership at JD, but is he still in control?
description: While Liu has given up numerous roles at JD.com, his influence remains unchallenged at the sprawling business empire he founded a quarter century ago.

author: Lucio Blanco Pitlo III, Lucio Blanco Pitlo III
title: Manila’s new China envoy key to Marcos Jnr’s plan to improve bilateral ties
description: Nomination of Jaime FlorCruz, former CNN Beijing Bureau Chief and long-time China resident may help Ferdinand Marcos Jnr shape a more informed policy towards the Philippines largest trade partner.

author: Liya Su, Liya Su
title: ‘They stole my baby’: Chinese woman discovers son is alive 17 years after relatives took him and told her he was dead
description: The story of a woman who was told 17 years ago that her baby boy had died by relatives - who then stole the child in an illegal adoption - has found her son in a case that has shocked China.

author: Agence France-Presse, Agence France-Presse
title: ‘We are Ukraine’: locals hail Russian retreat from Kherson
description: After an eight-month Russian occupation, Ukrainian television resumed broadcasting in the city and the region’s energy provider said it was working to restore power supplies.

author: Amy Sood, Amy Sood
title: Malaysia election 2022: meet 7 women shaking up a political scene saturated by men
description: Women make up more than half of Malaysia’s registered voters, but in the last general election less than 11 per cent of state assembly candidates were female, meaning women’s issues are often neglected.

author: Regina Ip, Regina Ip
title: Can Hong Kong reprise its role as China’s intermediary and window on the world?
description: If Hong Kong wants to continue to succeed in China’s new-era socialist system, its people must maintain their capacity for independent thinking and outward-looking character.

author: Enid Tsui, Enid Tsui
title: Hong Kong’s ‘art tech’ push means more AI, VR and NFTs but a lack of creative spark
description: As Hong Kong institutions pour money into art tech, some criticise the content as uninspiring and prioritising technology over creativity.

author: Natalie Wong, Natalie Wong
title: Beijing can help Hong Kong society heal by saying where ‘red lines’ of national security law lie, says Catholic bishop
description: The main crisis in city’s wounded society is that different groups only think of their own interests, says Bishop Stephen Chow
